text:
When I try to access to a page the compiler seems to add to the initial url 
another url (beginning with the word "Service") following the initial. It 
causes a too long url.

creator: plaurencine@reef.com
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
The stack trace you show here is the rethrown exception.  The Tomcat default
error handling would show in the browser both this exception and the "root
cause" exception.  It is the "root cause" that will show where the error is
occuring.  Please supply the "root cause" exception stack trace.  If necessary,
you can catch the ServletException and get the "root cause" with the
getRootCause() method.  Then output the exception to the browser or log file.
Thanks.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
Insufficient information is available to try to duplicate. Marking bug as
"invalid". 

Names that are too long is an OS limitation and aren't under Tomcat's control.
Tomcat 3.3 uses shorter names, so this should be less of a problem.  The root
cause of the exception isn't shown so we can't be sure this is the error.
